name: Blondies
description: These rich, chewy, and buttery Blondies are every bit as delicious as they look and so easy to make! The perfect sweet dessert!

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Cut the butter into several tablespoon-sized chunks and add it to a small light-colored skillet. Heat the butter over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the butter solids turn deep brown and develop a nutty aroma (it will first become foamy, then the solids will sink to the bottom and turn brown).
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Cut the butter into several tablespoon-sized chunks and add it to a small light-colored skillet. Heat the butter over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the butter solids turn deep brown and develop a nutty aroma (it will first become foamy, then the solids will sink to the bottom and turn brown).

recipeInstructions.text: While the butter is browning, add the brown sugar and granulated white sugar to a large mixing bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: While the butter is browning, add the brown sugar and granulated white sugar to a large mixing bowl.

recipeInstructions.text: Once the butter has browned, remove it from the heat immediately to prevent burning, and carefully pour it into the mixing bowl with the sugars. Whisk the brown butter and both sugars together until smooth.
recipeInstructions.name: Once the butter has browned, remove it from the heat immediately to prevent burning, and carefully pour it into the mixing bowl with the sugars. Whisk the brown butter and both sugars together until smooth.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the eggs and vanilla extract to the bowl and whisk until smooth.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the eggs and vanilla extract to the bowl and whisk until smooth.

recipeInstructions.text: In a separate bowl, stir together the all-purpose flour, baking powder, and salt until well combined. Add the flour mixture to the bowl with the wet ingredients. Use a rubber spatula to stir the flour into the batter until evenly combined.
recipeInstructions.name: In a separate bowl, stir together the all-purpose flour, baking powder, and salt until well combined. Add the flour mixture to the bowl with the wet ingredients. Use a rubber spatula to stir the flour into the batter until evenly combined.

recipeInstructions.text: Finally add the white chocolate chips to the batter and fold them in until just combined.
recipeInstructions.name: Finally add the white chocolate chips to the batter and fold them in until just combined.

recipeInstructions.text: Line an 8x8 baking dish with parchment paper. Add the blondie batter to the baking dish and spread it out evenly. Feel free to add a few more white chocolate chips on top of the batter.
recipeInstructions.name: Line an 8x8 baking dish with parchment paper. Add the blondie batter to the baking dish and spread it out evenly. Feel free to add a few more white chocolate chips on top of the batter.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake the blondies in the preheated oven for 35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake the blondies in the preheated oven for 35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove the blondies from the oven and let them cool for 10-15 minutes before lifting the parchment paper out of the baking dish. Slice into 12 bars and serve.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove the blondies from the oven and let them cool for 10-15 minutes before lifting the parchment paper out of the baking dish. Slice into 12 bars and serve.

review.reviewBody: I made these last night, and the only thing I changed was using caramel chips as well as white chocolate chips. It was super easy, and the end result is just delicious. Browning the butter takes a couple extra minutes, but it is SO worth it.

These are DELICIOUS! I’ve made them 4 times already and every time they barely last 24 hours before my whole family devours them. The brown butter really takes it to the next level. 
I used unsalted butter and added an  extra 1/4 tsp of salt. I baked mine in an 8x8 glass pan, lowered the temp to 325F and cooked them for 45 mins and they were perfect. I will absolutely be making these the next time I need to bring a dessert to a get together!
Mine needed about 45 minutes or so in the oven. Even with the extra time, they were still plenty gooey and soft. They were a big hit at an event. Will be making again.

I just tried this recipe and mine came out the same way. Baked at 350 for 34 minutes- the top is golden and crunchy, middle is raw. Put back in oven for 10 minutes with foil over the top, still raw in the middle. Put back in for 15, no improvement. I even had them baking in an 8 x 10 dish. I am going to eat the gooey mess anyway because the batter is SO tasty, but kinda bummed the texture is not right.

Super delicious recipe! I love blondies, and have fond memories of eating them in years past. I'm lactose intolerant, so I did a bit of researching how to do brown butter, since my vegan butter substitute, Earth Balance, does not brown on its own (it will get brownish, but it won't get aromatic and nutty like real butter). This may sound strange, but I read you can add a bit of soy sauce (I added about a teaspoon) at the end of the butter melting process, and it adds the extra depth and color. I have to say that the flavor tasted weird in the butter, but once it all baked up, it tasted absolutely delicious. That said, I did not get the texture right. I could tell just in the mixing process that my batter was too stiff, and I'm not sure if that was from cooking the butter too long, overmixing, or what. It did not affect the finished product dramatically at all, but a little denser than I could see the pictures here were. Let me know if anyone else tries it - I'd love to hear how it went!
These were delicious and easy! They were gobbled up in HOURS!

Wow! These are amazing!! I put in chocolate chips since I had them on hand. I think they would be great with macadamia nuts as well. 
Thank you for another delicious recipe!

Greetings from Chile, my country.
The recipe for blondies is very good.
As a contribution:
For people intolerant to gluten, you can change wheat flour for oat flour.
Grinding the flakes is easy, with a blender or even with your hands.
Oats are gluten-free and we invite celiacs to try this recipe, following these same simple steps.
It is very good with oatmeal!


 gluten free recipes

This was a good way to use up some of the remaining pantry items I got for holiday baking! The taste was perfect but I was really worried that my Blondie's were still raw, yet the toothpick came out clean. What I thought was a sign that they were undercooked was actually proof that I hadn't really creamed the wet ingredients together thoroughly, so my butter sort of separated from everything. Wah-wah. But I'll try these again now that I know how to get them perfect the second time!
Super yummy and chewy. I did end up needing to bake them for about 20 minutes more than what the recipe says. So tasty though!!
I learned to make these growing up in the 60s, when they were a major favorite with all of us. We called them "Butterscotch Brownies", using butterscotch chips, and sometimes nuts.
I love this!  I added Maladon salt flakes to the top!  Delicious!
